intro: Oenothera grisea, commonly known as the gray evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant has hairy, gray-green foliage and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elongated seeds. Oenothera grisea is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
